review_title: Not for me. But otherwise not a bad flashlight.
reviews:
It’s a bit smaller than I like. I am a woman in law enforcement with a medium sized hand. I purchased this flashlight to minimize the weight on my duty belt. However the pouch that the flashlight comes along with, doesn’t fit on my duty belt. So that’s a downer. I found another place to secure
It on the outside of my vest. And the first problem I noticed is that it’s super small in my hand and easily slips out of my hand when I attempt to hold the button down to turn the flashlight on. Then after 3 days of having the flashlight and case on my belt the flashlight slipped out of the secure pouch and has been lost forever! So maybe it was me but the pouch did not secure my flashlight in secure enough for it not to slip out. I guess I’m out close to $40.00.

It’s not a bad flashlight, just a bit too small for a male hand, I think. And it doesn’t stay secure enough in the case to handle any kind of scuffle or numerous in and out of your cruiser type days.

review_title: An annoying, ineffective hassle to use.
reviews: I bought this product for the lumens. Its annoying to use. You cannot just turn it on. You must hold the button down, but not for too long. Then, once you have given away your position, You must toggle through the intensity to the brightness you would like. Its such a hassle to use that it not going to be used. You cannot reprogram the switch either. Its simply capable of being bright and not much else. Go figure this is Chinese made stuff. No one who actually uses a flashlight for law enforcement is going to sit and wait to turn on, then toggle through brightness modes while illuminating a thief trying to bolt cut a lock from a bike or quickly illuminate someone smoking crack. You can't do it. This light is probably designed by the chinese to get people killed while they fumble around with there trashlight. Screw this flashlight. I hate it.

review_title: East to use torch for the flashlight challenged.
reviews: At first I wasn’t a big fan but since I’ve had this torch for awhile now it has worked perfectly and has really grown on me. It is a solid good basic Rechargeable torch at a great price. A great flashlight for someone that just wants a good simple and reliable flashlight. Hold the tail switch for a few seconds and it turns on in the lowest setting, click again and goes to medium once more to high. Hold tail switch for a few seconds and it turns off. That’s it nothing fancy perfect for my 85 year old Dad or someone that wants Basic! The beam is not too floody and not too throwy nice blend. Easily reaches any area of our 3 acres.

review_title: Good Light But Not Suitable for Self Defense
reviews:
This flashlight is very well made, seems like it's very durable and is definitely VERY bright and throws a beam a long way, on the brightest setting.

My disappointment is in the controls. The tail switch is recessed which means it takes more effort to push the button than it would if the switch was flush with the end of the light, or if it protruded just a little. That's a minor concern that can be overcome with practice. My big problem is in the way it operates. You have to push and hold the switch for 3 seconds (according to my clock) before the light comes on. When it comes on, it is on its lowest light setting and you then have to push the button 2 more times to get to the brightest setting, which is what I want for use in a defensive situation. For a defensive situation I want BRIGHT light NOW because almost anyone who is staging an attack 21 feet away can close that distance with a contact weapon in one and a half seconds which means that while I'm waiting 3 seconds for the light to come on and another 1-1.5 seconds to get it bright enough to be effective, the attacker would be on me. That means that for a surprise attack, this light would be useless for lighting up the scene before it was too late. Also, once the light is on its lowest brightness setting, if you push the switch too fast, the light does not change....and in a defense situation, when you are anxious, it would take another level of self discipline to push the switch slowly.

Also, the shipping box was in good condition when I received it, but the display box containing the light and accessories was broken open on two sides and there were no instructions. If this light is programmable to change the settings, I don't know how to do it.

Bottom line: I bought this light and still need to shop for one that doesn't have these basic problems.
product_name: NITECORE NM01 1000 Lumen Small USB Rechargeable Everyday Carry Flashlight

review_title: Took Some Time, But It's Now My Favorite Light!
reviews: I almost returned it immediately because you have to hold down the back button for a couple seconds in order to activate the light - which WAS, just freaking annoying. Another thing that's still annoying is it always starts on the lowest brightness, then medium bright (ZERO POINT IN THREE SETTINGS - Low and High is ALL YOU NEED!), THEN brightest setting with the last click. So basically, to put this light into action you have to hold down the button a couple seconds, then click the button twice. To turn it off you have to hold down the button for a couple seconds as well. I understand their reasoning behind this but I don't know - still kind of annoying getting use to the process. I do like that you can't really ND this light or have it turn on accidentally in your duffel bag or whatever. Last complaint, it's definitely not 1000 lumens like they claim. Maybe 700 at most...anyway, I've decided to keep it because the size of it is perfect for my needs and for $40 you can't be too mad.

review_title: Good light, but a pain to use
reviews:
I wish I had noticed the bit about mashing the button down and waiting an eternity, or approximately one second in this case, for the light to turn on/off. Definitely _*NOT*_ a tactical light, where one needs light instantly to identify a potential target.

Otherwise, it's a good light. Tough aluminum exterior with good finishing on all exposed surfaces, including the threads on the end caps. Positive operation of the thumb switch. I don't have as many Nitecore lights as I do Thrunite or Olight, but so far the quality is right up there with those others.

reviews:
Picked up my flashlight at the post office this morning. Brought it home and plugged it into the USB port on my computer and charged for 5 hours and nothing. Will not charge. No indicator lights or anything. Plugged it into the wall charger that is usb I use for my Fitbit, and still no charge.

The battery is built in so you can't replace or check the battery. I am guessing since this in an old model of Nitecore, the battery completely drained or was bad from the beginning. I will be returning this one for a refund. I like Nitecore flashlights. Bought one for my sister who lives out in the country with few lights and she loves it. I just will not but a model again where I cannot remove/replace the battery.
